alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Bamberg; Barnwell; Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 2:54PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia and central South Carolina, including the following areas, in east central Georgia, Richmond. In central South Carolina, Aiken, Bamberg, Barnwell and Orangeburg. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 251 PM EDT, Doppler radar and trained spotters have indicated heavy rain. This has caused urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to half an inch is possible over eastern Barnwell County. This additional rain may result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aiken, Barnwell, Denmark, Savannah River Site, Aiken Mall, Williston, Blackville, New Ellenton, Jackson, Aiken State Park, Barnwell State Park, Citizens Park, Gloverville, Augusta Regional Airport, Burnettown, Springfield, Hilda, Snelling and Olar. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 10 and 15. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
